docs.id: DPDPA Rules/Additional Obligations of Significant Data Fiduciaries
docs.title: Rule 12: Additional Obligations of Significant Data Fiduciaries (SDFs)
docs.description: Rule 12 sets out the enhanced responsibilities for Significant Data Fiduciaries (SDFs). These are entities identified by the Central Government on the basis of factors such as the volume and sensitivity of personal data processed, the potential impact on the rights of individuals, or concerns relating to sovereignty, integrity, or public order.
docs.source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/12 - Additional Obligations of Significant Data Fiduciaries.md
docs.slug: /DPDPA Rules/Additional Obligations of Significant Data Fiduciaries
docs.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Additional Obligations of Significant Data Fiduciaries
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/12 - Additional Obligations of Significant Data Fiduciaries.md

previous.title: Rule 11: Exemptions for Processing Children’s Data

docs.id: DPDPA Rules/Contact Information for Queries about Processing
docs.title: Rule 9: Contact Information for Queries about Processing
docs.description: Rule 9 ensures that individuals always know whom to contact if they have questions or concerns about how their personal data is being used. Transparency is not just about publishing a notice; it also requires giving people a clear channel of communication.
docs.source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/09 - Contact Information for Queries about Processing.md
docs.slug: /DPDPA Rules/Contact Information for Queries about Processing
docs.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Contact Information for Queries about Processing
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/09 - Contact Information for Queries about Processing.md

previous.title: Rule 8: When the Specified Purpose is Deemed No Longer Served
previous.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/When the Specified Purpose is Deemed No Longer Served

next.title: Rule 10: Verifiable Consent for Children and Persons with Disabilities
next.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Verifiable Consent for Children and Persons with Disabilities

docs.id: DPDPA Rules/Definitions
docs.title: Rule 2: Definitions
docs.description: Rule 2 provides the key definitions that are used throughout the Digital Personal Data Protection Rules, 2025. These definitions ensure clarity and consistency in interpretation.
docs.source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/02 - Definitions.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/02 - Definitions.md

previous.title: Rule 1: Short Title and Commencement

next.title: Rule 3: Notice by Data Fiduciary to Data Principal
next.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Notice by Data Fiduciary to Data Principal

docs.id: DPDPA Rules/Exemptions for Processing Children’s Data
docs.title: Rule 11: Exemptions for Processing Children’s Data
docs.description: While Rule 10 requires parental or guardian consent before processing a child’s personal data, Rule 11 introduces certain exemptions. These exemptions exist because not every instance of handling a child’s data poses a risk, and the law recognizes the need for practical flexibility.
docs.source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/11- Exemptions for Processing Children’s Data.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/11- Exemptions for Processing Children’s Data.md

previous.title: Rule 10: Verifiable Consent for Children and Persons with Disabilities
previous.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Verifiable Consent for Children and Persons with Disabilities

next.title: Rule 12: Additional Obligations of Significant Data Fiduciaries (SDFs)
next.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Additional Obligations of Significant Data Fiduciaries

docs.id: DPDPA Rules/Intimation of Personal Data Breach
docs.title: Rule 7: Intimation of Personal Data Breach
docs.description: When a personal data breach occurs, timing and transparency are everything. Rule 7 of the Draft Rules requires that both the Data Protection Board of India and the affected individuals must be informed without delay.
docs.source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/07 - Intimation of Personal Data Breach.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/07 - Intimation of Personal Data Breach.md

previous.title: Rule 6: Reasonable Security Safeguards

next.title: Rule 8: When the Specified Purpose is Deemed No Longer Served
next.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/When the Specified Purpose is Deemed No Longer Served

docs.id: DPDPA Rules/Notice by Data Fiduciary to Data Principal
docs.title: Rule 3: Notice by Data Fiduciary to Data Principal
docs.description: Rule 3 requires every Data Fiduciary to provide a clear and accessible notice to the Data Principal before processing personal data. The notice must be a separate and easily understandable document, and not hidden within lengthy terms and conditions.
docs.source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/03 - Notice by Data Fiduciary to Data Principal.md
docs.slug: /DPDPA Rules/Notice by Data Fiduciary to Data Principal
docs.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Notice by Data Fiduciary to Data Principal
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/03 - Notice by Data Fiduciary to Data Principal.md

previous.title: Rule 2: Definitions

next.title: Rule 4: Registration and Obligations of Consent Manager
next.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Registration and Obligations of Consent Manager

docs.id: DPDPA Rules/Processing for Subsidy, Benefit, Service, Licence or Permit by the State
docs.title: Rule 5: Processing for Subsidy, Benefit, Service, Licence or Permit by the State
docs.description: Rule 5 allows the State and its instrumentalities to process personal data when it is necessary for delivering subsidies, benefits, services, licences, or permits to individuals. This provision ensures that government functions which rely on personal data can continue without interruption, while still being subject to safeguards.
docs.source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/05 - Processing for Subsidy, Benefit, Service, Licence or Permit by the State.md
docs.slug: /DPDPA Rules/Processing for Subsidy, Benefit, Service, Licence or Permit by the State
docs.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Processing for Subsidy, Benefit, Service, Licence or Permit by the State
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/05 - Processing for Subsidy, Benefit, Service, Licence or Permit by the State.md

previous.title: Rule 4: Registration and Obligations of Consent Manager
previous.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Registration and Obligations of Consent Manager

next.title: Rule 6: Reasonable Security Safeguards

docs.id: DPDPA Rules/Reasonable Security Safeguards
docs.title: Rule 6: Reasonable Security Safeguards
docs.description: Rule 6 requires every Data Fiduciary to implement reasonable security safeguards to protect personal data against unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or loss. The obligation is proactive, meaning organizations must secure data before problems occur rather than waiting until after a breach.
docs.source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/06 - Reasonable Security Safeguards.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/06 - Reasonable Security Safeguards.md

docs.id: DPDPA Rules/Registration and Obligations of Consent Manager
docs.title: Rule 4: Registration and Obligations of Consent Manager
docs.description: Rule 4 establishes the framework for the registration and functioning of Consent Managers, which are specialized entities designed to help individuals manage their consents effectively.
docs.source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/04 - Registration and Obligations of Consent Manager.md
docs.slug: /DPDPA Rules/Registration and Obligations of Consent Manager
docs.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Registration and Obligations of Consent Manager

docs.id: DPDPA Rules/Title and Commencement
docs.title: Rule 1: Short Title and Commencement
docs.description: This rule specifies that the regulations shall be called the Digital Personal Data Protection Rules, 2025.
docs.source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/01 - Title and Commencement.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/01 - Title and Commencement.md

previous.title: Penalties and Enforcement under the DPDPA

next.title: Rule 2: Definitions

docs.id: DPDPA Rules/Verifiable Consent for Children and Persons with Disabilities
docs.title: Rule 10: Verifiable Consent for Children and Persons with Disabilities
docs.description: Rule 10 introduces additional safeguards for the protection of children and persons with disabilities who may not be in a position to fully understand the implications of sharing their personal data. To ensure fairness, the law requires that their data can only be processed with verifiable consent from a parent or a lawful guardian.
docs.source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/10 - Verifiable Consent for Children and Persons with Disabilities.md
docs.slug: /DPDPA Rules/Verifiable Consent for Children and Persons with Disabilities
docs.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Verifiable Consent for Children and Persons with Disabilities
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/10 - Verifiable Consent for Children and Persons with Disabilities.md

previous.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/Contact Information for Queries about Processing

next.title: Rule 11: Exemptions for Processing Children’s Data

docs.id: DPDPA Rules/When the Specified Purpose is Deemed No Longer Served
docs.title: Rule 8: When the Specified Purpose is Deemed No Longer Served
docs.description: Rule 8 addresses a fundamental principle of data protection: personal data should not be kept forever. Once the purpose for which the data was collected has been fulfilled, the organization is required to stop holding it.
docs.source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/08 - When the Specified Purpose is Deemed No Longer Served.md
docs.slug: /DPDPA Rules/When the Specified Purpose is Deemed No Longer Served
docs.permalink: /dpdpa-docs/docs/DPDPA Rules/When the Specified Purpose is Deemed No Longer Served

docs.id: Overview/Background and Purpose of DPDPA
docs.title: Background and Purpose of DPDPA
docs.description: The Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDPA), 2023 represents India’s first comprehensive framework dedicated to safeguarding the privacy of individuals in the digital age. This legislation, accompanied by the Draft Rules released in January 2025, establishes a structured regime for how organizations, governments, and intermediaries collect, process, store, and share personal data. Its enactment is a direct response to the exponential growth of India’s digital economy and the increasing volume of personal information being processed on digital platforms. By codifying the responsibilities of organizations and the rights of individuals, DPDPA provides a legal foundation to ensure that privacy is not merely aspirational but enforceable.
docs.source: @site/docs/1. Overview/Background and Purpose of DPDPA.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/1. Overview/Background and Purpose of DPDPA.md

next.title: Scope & Applicability of DPDPA

docs.id: Overview/Cross-Border Data Transfers under DPDPA
docs.title: Cross-Border Data Transfers under DPDPA
docs.description: One of the most debated questions in data protection is: Can personal data leave the country? The Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDPA), 2023 addresses this directly. India has chosen a balanced path — allowing cross-border transfers but retaining the power to restrict them when necessary.
docs.source: @site/docs/1. Overview/Cross-Border Data Transfers under DPDPA.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/1. Overview/Cross-Border Data Transfers under DPDPA.md

previous.title: Security Safeguards and Breach Notification

next.title: Penalties and Enforcement under the DPDPA

docs.id: Overview/Duties and Obligations of Data Fiduciaries
docs.title: Duties and Obligations of Data Fiduciaries
docs.description: Under the Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDPA), 2023, every organization or government body that decides how and why personal data is processed is called a Data Fiduciary. The Act places clear responsibilities on Data Fiduciaries to ensure that they handle data lawfully, fairly, and with respect for individuals’ privacy. These duties are not optional; they are legal requirements that apply to all entities handling personal data.
docs.source: @site/docs/1. Overview/Duties and Obligations of Data Fiduciaries.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/1. Overview/Duties and Obligations of Data Fiduciaries.md

previous.title: Rights of Data Principals

next.title: Special Duties of Significant Data Fiduciaries

docs.id: Overview/Key Definitions under DPDPA
docs.title: Key Definitions under DPDPA
docs.description: To understand the framework of the Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDPA), 2023, it is essential to become familiar with its core definitions. These terms are consistently used throughout the Act and the Draft Rules of 2025, and they form the foundation for interpreting rights, duties, and obligations.
docs.source: @site/docs/1. Overview/Key Definitions under DPDPA.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/1. Overview/Key Definitions under DPDPA.md

previous.title: Scope & Applicability of DPDPA

next.title: Rights of Data Principals

docs.id: Overview/Penalties and Enforcement under the DPDPA
docs.title: Penalties and Enforcement under the DPDPA
docs.description: The Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDPA), 2023 is not just a statement of rights and duties; it is a binding law with real consequences for non-compliance. To ensure that organizations treat personal data with seriousness, the Act empowers the Data Protection Board of India to enforce compliance and impose penalties when violations occur.
docs.source: @site/docs/1. Overview/Penalties and Enforcement under the DPDPA.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/1. Overview/Penalties and Enforcement under the DPDPA.md

previous.title: Cross-Border Data Transfers under DPDPA

next.title: Rule 1: Short Title and Commencement

docs.id: Overview/Rights of Data Principals
docs.title: Rights of Data Principals
docs.description: The Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDPA), 2023 gives every individual, known as the Data Principal, a set of rights over their personal data. These rights ensure that people are not left powerless once their information is collected by a company, government body, or any other organization. Instead, they have the ability to control how their data is used, corrected, and even deleted.
docs.source: @site/docs/1. Overview/Rights of Data Principals.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/1. Overview/Rights of Data Principals.md

previous.title: Key Definitions under DPDPA

next.title: Duties and Obligations of Data Fiduciaries

docs.id: Overview/Role of Consent Managers
docs.title: Role of Consent Managers
docs.description: One of the most innovative features of the Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDPA), 2023 is the introduction of Consent Managers. These are independent, registered entities whose sole purpose is to help individuals exercise control over their personal data. Unlike traditional systems where each company manages consent separately, Consent Managers act as a neutral platform that allows people to view, grant, and withdraw consent across multiple services in one place.
docs.source: @site/docs/1. Overview/Role of Consent Managers.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/1. Overview/Role of Consent Managers.md

previous.title: Special Duties of Significant Data Fiduciaries

next.title: The Data Protection Board of India

docs.id: Overview/Scope & Applicability of DPDPA
docs.title: Scope & Applicability of DPDPA
docs.description: The Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDPA), 2023, along with its Draft Rules of 2025, establishes a framework that applies broadly across entities and sectors in India. Its scope is deliberately wide to ensure that any processing of personal data affecting individuals within India is governed by uniform standards of accountability, transparency, and security.
docs.source: @site/docs/1. Overview/Scope & Applicability of DPDPA.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/1. Overview/Scope & Applicability of DPDPA.md

previous.title: Background and Purpose of DPDPA

next.title: Key Definitions under DPDPA

docs.id: Overview/Security Safeguards and Breach Notification
docs.title: Security Safeguards and Breach Notification
docs.description: The Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDPA), 2023 requires every organization, whether small or large, to protect the personal data it collects with strong technical and organizational safeguards. Security is not treated as an afterthought; it is the backbone of compliance. Organizations are expected to anticipate risks, prevent misuse, and respond immediately when things go wrong.
docs.source: @site/docs/1. Overview/Security Safeguards and Breach Notification.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/1. Overview/Security Safeguards and Breach Notification.md

previous.title: The Data Protection Board of India

next.title: Cross-Border Data Transfers under DPDPA

docs.id: Overview/Special Duties of Significant Data Fiduciaries
docs.title: Special Duties of Significant Data Fiduciaries
docs.description: The Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDPA), 2023 recognizes that certain organizations handle much larger volumes of personal data or process data that is highly sensitive. Because misuse or mishandling of such data can have severe consequences for individuals and even for national security, the government can classify such entities as Significant Data Fiduciaries (SDFs). Banks, healthcare providers, social media platforms, telecom companies, and large technology firms are examples of organizations that are likely to fall under this category.
docs.source: @site/docs/1. Overview/Special Duties of Significant Data Fiduciaries.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/1. Overview/Special Duties of Significant Data Fiduciaries.md

previous.title: Duties and Obligations of Data Fiduciaries

next.title: Role of Consent Managers

docs.id: Overview/The Data Protection Board of India
docs.title: The Data Protection Board of India
docs.description: The Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDPA), 2023 establishes the Data Protection Board of India as the central regulatory authority responsible for monitoring compliance, handling grievances, and ensuring enforcement of the law. The creation of the Board is a cornerstone of the Act because without an independent authority, the rights of individuals and the obligations of organizations would remain largely theoretical.
docs.source: @site/docs/1. Overview/The Data Protection Board of India.md
docs.editUrl: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/main/packages/create-docusaurus/templates/shared/docs/1. Overview/The Data Protection Board of India.md

metadata.title: Welcome
metadata.description: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.

blogPosts.content:
[Docusaurus blogging features](https://docusaurus.io/docs/blog) are powered by the [blog plugin](https://docusaurus.io/docs/api/plugins/@docusaurus/plugin-content-blog).

Here are a few tips you might find useful.

<!-- truncate -->

Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the `blog` directory.

Regular blog authors can be added to `authors.yml`.

The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as:

- `2019-05-30-welcome.md`
- `2019-05-30-welcome/index.md`

A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images:

![Docusaurus Plushie](./docusaurus-plushie-banner.jpeg)

The blog supports tags as well!

**And if you don't want a blog**: just delete this directory, and use `blog: false` in your Docusaurus config.

metadata.title: MDX Blog Post
metadata.description: Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX.

blogPosts.content:
Blog posts support [Docusaurus Markdown features](https://docusaurus.io/docs/markdown-features), such as [MDX](https://mdxjs.com/).

:::tip

Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts.

:::

{/* truncate */}

For example, use JSX to create an interactive button:

```js
<button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button>
```

<button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button>

metadata.title: Long Blog Post
metadata.description: This is the summary of a very long blog post,

blogPosts.content:
This is the summary of a very long blog post,

Use a `<!--` `truncate` `-->` comment to limit blog post size in the list view.

<!-- truncate -->

default.title: Markdown page example
default.description: You don't need React to write simple standalone pages.
